PDFxTMD Library

Introduction

PDFxTMD is a novel library designed for parton distribution functions (PDFs) that integrates both collinear PDFs (cPDFs) and transverse momentum-dependent PDFs (TMDs). It aims to provide a unified and efficient framework for PDF computations, enhancing the toolkit available to the high-energy physics community.

Features

  • Supports both collinear and transverse momentum-dependent PDFs.
  • Utilizes modern C++ principles for high performance and extensibility.
  • Well-defined interfaces for reading PDF grid files, interpolation, and extrapolation.
  • Compatible with standard file formats from LHAPDF and TMDLib.
  • Adaptable to non-standard formats through its extensible architecture.

Usage

The PDFxTMD library is designed to facilitate cross-section calculations in both collinear and kt-factorization frameworks. Users can implement tailored solutions for their specific needs, making it a versatile tool for researchers in high-energy physics.

Learn More

For more details, you can view the full paper: PDFxTMDLib: a parton distribution library for both transverse and collinear parton distribution functions.
